title: DISTANCE UNKNOWN
synopsis: 50 years after the Vietnam War, two students from Hanoi travel to Orange County, California, where many Vietnamese war refugees settled in the 1970s. There, they asked three generations of Vietnamese American men, unknown to one another, to reflect on their national heritage.
availability: The film is currently in post-production and is scheduled to release in mid-2026. See Press Gallery for open positions and contact information.

title: A SHORT FILM ABOUT LOVING
synopsis: Due to COVID-19, students from a utopian high school are forced to return home. Heartbroken from a recent break up, Tom wanders around and confronts lovers who were also experiencing separation.
screenings: OKIA Outdoor Cinema (Hanoi, Vietnam), Fulbright University Vietnam (HCMC, Vietnam), Mahindra United World College (Pune, India), Olympia Cinema (Cannes, France)

title: LAST DAYS
synopsis: Pressed to do well in classes, Juan is oblivious to everything that takes place around him. That is, until an incident completely disrupts his routine.
availability: This film is available on YouTube.
